text:
Any reason why the cms dev server has so many vulnerabilities?
```19 vulnerabilities (7 moderate, 1 high, 11 critical)```

Also are secrets working for others, I can't seem to add in a secret through the CLI, just get the error:

```[ERROR] The secret "GOOGLE_API" was not added```
name, value all correct and latest cli package

Some context in <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/issues/47|https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/issues/47>

We could do better, but for nearly all of these, it is noise and irrelevant for a local only process.
We will probably have to defer to The CLI team for that… but worth checking, does `hs secrets list` work?

No, also throws an error, where can i reach the CLI team for this?
```[ERROR] The secrets could not be listed```
This website is built with vuejs with Laravel backend. Is it possible to build this with JS rendering block and custom object in HubSpot?
Definetly possible but won't be simple to build. Would probobly have to fit all of this in either 1 module or partial though
Yea. I thought so too. But I'm not sure about the Custom Objects to replace the database.
Yeah HubDB isn't relational so probobly would have to be custom objects
Unless you make a pretty complex hubdb table
So custom object is the way to go and possible right?

I mean I'd have to see the current DB to give a 100% anwser. If possible try doing this in HubDB as thats the intented way but worst case scenario you can do this with custom objects since they offer more flexbility and tie in well to the CRM if your client is using that. Too many factors to consider too give a straight anwser rn

Is this supported in the project folder?
```"compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl" : ".",
    "paths": {
      "*": ["./*"],
      "@assets/*": ["./assets/*"],
      "@styles/*": ["./styles/*"],
    }
  },```
At the moment I always get this error message:
```Building JS Project with error message `[vite]: Rollup failed to resolve import "@styles/layout.module.css?used" from "/tmp/cms_TPBpPn/cms-js-build/customer-package/components/Layout.jsx".
This is most likely unintended because it can break your application at runtime.
If you do want to externalize this module explicitly add it to
`build.rollupOptions.external`
file:///tmp/cms_TPBpPn/cms-js-build/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-68d1a114.js:48216
                    throw new Error(`[vite]: Rollup failed to resolve import "${exporter}" from "${id}".\n` +```
Nope it doesn’t work. But that is fixable (just haven’t gotten to it yet)
